definitions.example: The incorrigibles in the prison population are either lifers or habitual reoffenders.

definitions.definition: Defective and impossible to materially correct or set aright.
definitions.example: The construction flaw is incorrigible; any attempt to amend it would cause a complete collapse.
His dark soul was too incorrigible to repent, even at his execution.

definitions.definition: Impervious to correction by punishment or pain.
definitions.example: The imp is incorrigible: his bottom is still red from his last spanking when he plans the next prank.

definitions.definition: Determined, unalterable, hence impossible to improve upon.
definitions.example: The laws of nature and mathematics are incorrigible.
